page.title: 08Farming A Dairy Farm
page.content: On Tuesday, 2lst May, l985 we went to a dairy farm to interview the farmer. He was a very nice man. We sat on some straw bails and then we went to see some friesian calves. They were very pretty and black and white in colour. The farmer had l44 cows. He chose friesians because they gave the most milk. He showed us the milking shed and we watched the cows being milked. The farmer also owned a young Hereford bull which was not very big but was very bossy. It had a ring in its nose. The bull went in with the other cows and just stood and waited until the cows were milked. At another farm Michael saw a calf that had been born less than 24 hours before. She was called Sarah.
